H0.text: Thin bark is the most likely genetic adaptation of desert plants to survive the hot, dry climate conditions.

H1.text: Waxy leaves are most likely a genetic adaptation of desert plants that allows them to survive hot, dry climate conditions.

H2.text: Leaves that remain all year are the most likely genetic adaptation of desert plants to survive hot, dry climate conditions.

H3.text: Flowers that bloom all year are most likely a genetic adaptation of desert plants to survive hot, dry climate conditions.

A4.text: Epicuticular wax crystals enhance their water repellency

A5.text: Epicuticular wax can reflect UV light, such as the white, chalky wax coating of Dudleya brittonii, which has the highest ultraviolet light (UV) reflectivity of any known naturally occurring biological substance.
